intro: Leiotulus isfahanicus, commonly known as the Isfahan spurge, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and distinctive yellow-orange cyathia. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and minimal water.
